snpGeneSets 2.0
  • Reference

Get genes in a genomic region

getRegionGene.Rd

The function identifies genes overlapping the candidate genomic region based on the NCBI Gene database of GRCh37/hg19 or GRCh38/hg38

Usage

getRegionGene(regionDF, GRCh=37)

Arguments

regionDF

It is a data frame. It must contain the columns of 'chr' and 'start'. The 'chr' is a character vector of chromosomes. The supported chromosome ID can be obtained by function, 'getChrs'. The 'start' is a integer or numeric vector of region start position. An optional column is 'end'. If 'end' exists, a genomic region will be defined by 'start' and 'end'. Otherwise, the genomic region will be the single nucleotide position defined by 'start'. The 'start' and 'end' position are based on unit of base pairs.

GRCh

The reference genome build number, either 37 or 38. If the number is 37, it is GRCh37 or hg19; and if the number is 38, it is GRCh38 or hg38

Details

The function applies three criteria to identify the overlapped genes in the candidate genomic region: 1) gene transcription start site is inside the genomic region; or 2) gene transcription stop site is inside the genomic region; or 3)the genomic region is inside the gene transcript.

Value

The returned value is a data frame.

chr

The chromosome ID of a gene

start

Gene transcription start site in base pair

end

Gene transcription stop site in base pair

strand

+ or - for strand

gene_name

The HGNC gene symbol

gene_id

The Entrez gene ID

References

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gene

Author

H Mei; L Li

Note

See also

getGeneMap

Examples

#get genes include position of 78786077 at chr 14
# regionDF=data.frame(chr="14", start=78786077, stringsAsFactors=FALSE);
# getRegionGene(regionDF)
# getRegionGene(regionDF,38)

#Get genes include specified start positions at multiple chromosomes 
# chr=c("14","1","18","16","16");
# start=c(78786077, 213910494, 57850422, 53813450, 53820527);
# end=start+1000;
# regionDF=data.frame(chr=chr, start=start, stringsAsFactors=FALSE);
# getRegionGene(regionDF)
# getRegionGene(regionDF,38)

#get genes at multiple genomic regions defined by 'start' and 'end'
# regionDF=data.frame(chr=chr, start=start, end=end, stringsAsFactors=FALSE);
# getRegionGene(regionDF)
# getRegionGene(regionDF,38)

#get all genes from position 1 t0 100000 bp at chr 1.
# getRegionGene(data.frame(chr="1", start=1, end=100000, stringsAsFactors=FALSE))
# getRegionGene(data.frame(chr="1", start=1, end=100000, stringsAsFactors=FALSE),38)
